tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE network_traffic_data (
  logging_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  source_ip VARCHAR(255),
  destination_ip VARCHAR(255),
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  protocol VARCHAR(50),
  data_size INT,
  suspected_activity BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    source_address VARCHAR(255),
    destination_address VARCHAR(255),
    protocol VARCHAR(50),
    data_size INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source_ip VARCHAR,
    destination_ip VARCHAR,
    data_size INT
);

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source_ip VARCHAR(255),
    destination_ip VARCHAR(255),
    protocol VARCHAR(50),
    amount_of_data INT
)

CREATE TABLE suspicious_activities (
    activity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    log_id INT,
    activity_description TEXT,
    detection_method VARCHAR(100),
    FOREIGN KEY (log_id) REFERENCES network_traffic_logs(log_id)
)

CREATE TABLE traffic_patterns (
    pattern_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    pattern_name VARCHAR(100),
    pattern_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE detected_attacks (
    attack_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    activity_id INT,
    attack_type VARCHAR(50),
    attack_description TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (activity_id) REFERENCES suspicious_activities(activity_id)
)

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_data (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMPTZ,
    source_ip INET,
    destination_ip INET,
    port_number INT,
    protocol VARCHAR(10),
    data_size INT
);

CREATE TABLE suspicious_activities (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMPTZ,
    source_ip INET,
    destination_ip INET,
    port_number INT,
    reason TEXT
);
